intro: Randia chiapensis, commonly known as the Chiapas randia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, round fruits that are typically yellow or orange when mature. Randia chiapensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks.
